alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 10 at 9:30AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Koyukuk River near Wiseman and Slate Creek at Coldfoot. * WHEN...Until 800 PM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over a portion of the access road into Wiseman from the Dalton Highway. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 917 AM AKDT, The river gauge on Slate Creek at Coldfoot was reporting minor flooding and water levels still rising from rain and snowmelt. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially along the Koyukuk from the Middle Fork north of Wiseman to just south of Coldfoot. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen since yesterday, and additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible through this evening. - For Slate Creek at Coldfoot: At 9:15am the stage was 19.25 feet. Flood Stage is 18.7 feet. Forecast: A crest is expected shortly and should start to fall to around 19 feet by noon Saturday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Koyukuk River stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
